p: C. violaceum ATCC 12,472 was used in the qualitative screening of violacein inhibition. Ten microliters of an overnight culture of C. violaceum ATCC 12,472 (OD adjusted to 0.4 at 600 nm) was added into wells of sterile microtiter plates containing 1 mL of LB broth and incubated in the presence and absence of various concentrations of TTO and terpinen-4-ol (MIC = 10 mg/mL until MIC/32 = 0.3125 mg/mL) at 30 Â°C for 18 h and observed for inhibition of violacein production [ 52].
